content: a court in rome has ruled on a case involving the dissolution of a community and the assignment of properties the court has ordered the dissolution of the community and the assignment of properties to various parties the properties include a villa in rome and an apartment in viterbo the court has remitted the case to a notary public for the sale of the properties through a public auction the court considered arguments and objections from the parties and made decisions based on the civil code they also conducted a technical evaluation of the properties and determined their values the court concluded that the properties should be assigned and sold through a public auction the final judgment includes the referral of the case to a notary public for the auction and deferral of the costs to the final judgment the court made a final ruling on february 20 2014 ordering the dissolution of the community and the sale of the property in viterbo at auction the proceeds will be used to assign a different property to one of the individuals involved and the parties will be responsible for the costs of the case
